body.p:
Boone Furnace Carter County
June 9th 1865
Wm Reassor Esqr.
Dear Sir

Mr Skines called upon to day in regard to his son in Prisson, at the time he was in Frankfort I have done all I possible could do in regard to his case. Col Hanson and myself (after he left went before the Governor, as he was a member of his Regt, and gave him all the prasie as in regard to a good soldier, and if the papers would have been there, the Governor would have repreived him at once.

There is nothing in the case and as you will find in the petition that he should come out of prisson get Mr Dupuy to do all he can in regard to his case, (in connection with his office) I am sattisfied that he has stayed long enough, do all you can let me hear from you
